sentence.Network_en: They browbeat him into signing the document.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们威逼他签署了文件.

sentence.Network_en: We shall never allow our police to browbeat prisoners into admitting their guilt.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们决不允许我们的警察对囚犯搞逼供.

sentence.Network_en: When I backed out of the 100 metres, an older kid tried to browbeat me into it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我要退出100米比赛的时候，一个年纪大些的孩子试图吓唬我就范。

list.abs: they browbeat him into signing the document .他们威逼他签署了文件。
The judge browbeat the witness ., 那法官威吓证人.
A story is told of a browbeating counsel ,, 这个故事讲的是一个咄咄逼人的辩护律师,
noisily domineering ; tending to browbeat others ., 吵闹 , 跋扈 ; 倾向于吓唬别人.

entry.def: If someone tries to browbeat you, they try to force you to do what they want.

example.ex: ...attempts to deceive, con, or browbeat the voters...
example.tran: 蒙蔽、欺骗或恫吓选民的企图

example.ex: When I backed out of the 100 metres, an older kid tried to browbeat me into it.
example.tran: 我要退出100米比赛的时候，一个年纪大些的孩子试图吓唬我就范。

sentences.sentence: "Her big brother always bullied her when she was young"

means.word_mean: 2. discourage or frighten with threats or a domineering manner; intimidate

auth_sentence.content: To a undecided looking in, it appears you have no argument, and must now browbeat the opposition to prove a point.

auth_sentence.content: Speer's unbuilt works seem oppressive, on a scale intended to browbeat anyone in their vicinity.
